de.upb.t2t.model

Class TranscriptionItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.upb.t2t.model.TranscriptionItem

  • public class TranscriptionItem
extends java.lang.Object

    One of the core classes of the application's data structure. A TranscriptionItem consists of its ID, the lemma associated with it and a String holding its broad phonetic transcription. Additionally, every instance of this class is associated with a corresponding WordClass, Variety and TranscriptionType object to make it distinguishable from others that might be transcribed in the same way but, in fact, need to be analysed differently.

    TranscriptionItems are not meant to be modified after their creation. However, it is possible to create an "empty" item that can function as a dummy (in order to avoid NullPointerExceptions. This might for example be the case if a new item should be added to the database and an AddTranscriptionPane is being created.

    Lastly, other objects may register listeners to a TranscriptionItem to get notified should e.g. the user select the item in the course of a transcription.

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    select(), addItemSelectionListener(SelectionListener), DatabaseEntry

      • select

        public void select()
        This method notifies all registered listeners, that this item has been selected. This might be the case if the user chose it for a transcription in case they had several options.
